page.title: 02NOSTELL PRIORY
page.content: Nostell Priory is the home of the Winn family. This magnificent Palladian Mansion was given to the National Trust in 1953. The present house was built on the site of a medieval priory. Work on the new priory was begun in 1733 by James Paine for Sir Rowland Winn. The Priory houses one of Englands finest collections of Chippendale furniture.Its other treasures include a famous portrait by Hans Holbein and a remarkable Eighteenth Century dolls house, complete with its orignal fittings and furniture. Set in open countryside the Priory offers a wide variety of leisure pursuits including camping, fishing and general sightseeing.
